intro: Brassica napus var. alba, commonly known as white mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, alternate leaves that are typically oval or lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by elongated, slender pods containing seeds. White mustard is native to Europe and Asia but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
